glosses: sincerely, from the heart, with all heart and soul

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish جان و گوڭلدن (cān-u-göñülden), from Persian جان (cān) + Arabic وَ (wa) + گوڭل (göñül), equivalent to can (“life, heart, soul”) + ve (“and”) + gönül (“heart”) + -den (ablative suffix), literally “from the soul and the heart”.
